benchmark_details.name: NSF-S CIFY
benchmark_details.overview: NSF-S CIFY is a large-scale dataset for scientific claim extraction derived from the National Science Foundation awards database, comprising over 400K grant abstracts and establishing grant proposals as a novel source for scientific claim extraction.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate large-scale scientific claim verification, discovery tracking, and meta-scientific research.

data.size: 412,155 abstracts with an estimated 2.8 million claims
data.annotation: Automatically generated through zero-shot prompting with large language models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as precision and recall are calculated based on comparisons between extracted claims and a gold standard using boolean functions with LLMs.
methodology.interpretation: High scores on metrics indicate successful extraction and generation quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance metrics significantly improve with fine-tuning, showing over 100% relative improvement for tasks.
methodology.validation: The dataset is processed and filtered to ensure quality and consistency.
